title: Mnemonic-Based Project Learning for Medication Therapy Evaluation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Pharmaceutical Knowledge (Mechanisms of Drug Action, Pharmacokinetics/Pharmacodynamics) and Patient History Analysis Methods
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning using personal devices, with case analyses based on real clinical scenarios

learning_goals: Learners can systematically identify key evaluation parameters of drug therapy using patient-centered mnemonic (ADME-Tox: Absorption, Distribution, Metabolism, Excretion, Toxicity).
Learners can improve their ability to evaluate treatment effects/side effects/interactions by over 70% in three or more clinical cases where mnemonics are applied.
Learners can write and present a 10-page drug therapy evaluation report as a project deliverable.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
